Class StockDataManager

java.lang.Object
StockDataManager
public class StockDataManager extends Object
The StockDataManager class manages a collection of stocks using an AVL tree for efficient storage and retrieval. It provides methods to add, update, remove, and search for stocks, as well as to print the stock data in various orders.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description
    StockDataManager()
    Constructs a new StockDataManager and initializes the AVL tree.

  • Method Details

    • addOrUpdateStock

      public void addOrUpdateStock(String symbol, double price, long volume, long marketCap)
      Adds a new stock or updates an existing stock with the provided details.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the stock symbol
      price - the stock price
      volume - the trading volume
      marketCap - the market capitalization

    • removeStock

      public void removeStock(String symbol)
      Removes a stock with the specified symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the stock symbol to remove

    • searchStock

      public Stock searchStock(String symbol)
      Searches for a stock with the specified symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the stock symbol to search for
      Returns:
      the Stock object if found, or null if not found

    • updateStock

      public void updateStock(String symbol, String newSymbol, double newPrice, long newVolume, long newMarketCap)
      Updates the details of an existing stock and re-inserts it into the AVL tree.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the current stock symbol
      newSymbol - the new stock symbol
      newPrice - the new stock price
      newVolume - the new trading volume
      newMarketCap - the new market capitalization

    • printInOrder
